alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 22 at 2:48PM MDT until March 23 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Chuska Mountains, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, and Jemez Mountains. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Due to the relatively warm temperatures, much of the snow will be heavy and wet, consisting of high moisture content. This may cause abnormally heavy weight on rooftops and other structures at high elevations.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
